article.Heading: Slow rural recovery even if Budget makes 'rural noises': CLSA
article.Summary: Rural recovery needs construction activity uptick and more so property sector revival, which does not appear likely in CY16, says CLSA
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Brokerage house CLSA feels a speedy recovery in the rural sector looks unlikely anytime soon as it feels rural demand revival cannot be driven by the Central Government. The brokerage expects the government to make some "rural noises" in the upcoming Budget.

Three reasons why CLSA feels a rural recovery is still some way off:
(Excerpts from the report)

* Lack of fiscal space: If the Government follows a tight fiscal policy (deficit of 3.5%), rural push would not be possible. Also, nearly 80% of the Government expenditure is already committed.

* Limited government impact: The Government’s 61 percent YTD (year-till-date) jump in capex in FY16 did not drive an overall capex upturn, as Government share of total spending is small and cannot drive a big delta in economic trends in just one year directly.

* Weak construction: Rural recovery needs construction activity uptick and more so property sector revival, which does not appear likely in CY16.
